questions.question: Servant leadership means the leader serves the team by removing impediments and providing support.

feedback.correct: Correct! Servant leadership focuses on serving the team's needs and removing obstacles to their success.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Servant leadership is about leaders serving their teams, not the other way around.

questions.explanation: Servant leaders focus on the growth and well-being of people and communities.

questions.question: The optimal Agile team size is typically 5-9 members including the Product Owner and Scrum Master.

feedback.correct: Correct! Research shows 5-9 members is optimal for communication and collaboration effectiveness.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. The optimal team size is 5-9 members for effective communication and decision-making.

questions.explanation: Smaller teams have better communication, while larger teams face coordination challenges.

questions.question: Cross-functional teams have all the skills necessary to deliver the product increment.

feedback.correct: Correct! Cross-functional teams possess all necessary skills to deliver working software.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Cross-functional teams are specifically designed to have all needed skills internally.

questions.explanation: Cross-functional teams reduce dependencies and increase delivery speed.

questions.question: Self-organizing teams choose how to best accomplish their work rather than being directed by others.

feedback.correct: Correct! Self-organizing teams have the autonomy to determine their own working methods.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Self-organizing teams specifically choose their own methods and approaches.

questions.explanation: Self-organization leads to higher motivation and better solutions.

questions.question: T-shaped skills refer to team members having deep expertise in one area and broad knowledge in many areas.

feedback.correct: Correct! T-shaped skills combine deep specialization (vertical) with broad collaboration abilities (horizontal).
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. T-shaped skills describe the combination of deep expertise and broad collaborative abilities.

questions.explanation: T-shaped skills enable both specialization and cross-functional collaboration.

questions.question: Colocation is always required for effective Agile teams.

feedback.correct: Correct! While colocation is preferred, distributed teams can be effective with proper tools and practices.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Colocation is beneficial but not always required; distributed teams can be successful.

questions.explanation: Modern tools and practices enable effective distributed Agile teams.

questions.question: Information radiators should provide real-time, visible project information to all stakeholders.

feedback.correct: Correct! Information radiators promote transparency by making project status visible to everyone.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Information radiators are specifically designed to provide visible, real-time information.

questions.explanation: Transparency through information radiators enables better decision-making.

questions.question: The Product Owner is responsible for managing the team's daily work and removing impediments.

feedback.correct: Correct! The Scrum Master manages daily work facilitation and impediment removal, not the Product Owner.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. The Product Owner focuses on product value; the Scrum Master handles team facilitation.

questions.explanation: Role separation ensures clear responsibilities and prevents conflicts of interest.

questions.question: Dedicated team members typically produce better results than part-time team members.

feedback.correct: Correct! Dedicated team members have better focus and reduced context switching overhead.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Dedicated team members avoid the productivity losses associated with context switching.

questions.explanation: Context switching between projects reduces efficiency and focus.

questions.question: Servant leaders focus on command-and-control management to ensure team productivity.

feedback.correct: Correct! Servant leaders focus on supporting and empowering teams, not command-and-control.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Servant leadership is the opposite of command-and-control management.

questions.explanation: Servant leadership empowers teams rather than controlling them.

questions.question: What is the primary role of a Product Owner in Scrum?

options.text: Maximize the value of the product

feedback.correct: Correct! The Product Owner is responsible for maximizing the value of the product and the work of the Development Team.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. The Product Owner's primary responsibility is maximizing product value through backlog management.

questions.explanation: Product Owners focus on 'what' to build and 'why' to maximize business value.

questions.question: What is the main responsibility of a Scrum Master?

feedback.correct: Correct! The Scrum Master serves the Scrum Team by facilitating events, coaching, and removing impediments.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. The Scrum Master's role is to serve the team, not manage or control them.

questions.explanation: Scrum Masters are servant leaders who help teams become more effective.

questions.question: According to research, what is the optimal size for an Agile development team?

feedback.correct: Correct! Research shows 5-9 members is optimal for communication effectiveness and team dynamics.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Studies consistently show 5-9 members as the optimal team size for Agile teams.

questions.explanation: Team size affects communication channels: too small lacks skills, too large creates communication overhead.

questions.question: Which leadership style is most associated with Agile environments?

feedback.correct: Correct! Servant leadership aligns with Agile values of empowering teams and removing obstacles.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Servant leadership is the leadership style most aligned with Agile principles and values.

questions.explanation: Servant leadership supports self-organizing teams and continuous improvement.

questions.question: What does 'T-shaped skills' refer to in Agile teams?

options.text: Deep skills in one area, broad knowledge in many

feedback.correct: Correct! T-shaped skills combine deep specialization with broad collaborative abilities.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. T-shaped skills describe the combination of deep expertise (vertical) and broad knowledge (horizontal).

questions.explanation: T-shaped professionals can collaborate effectively while maintaining deep expertise.

questions.question: Which characteristics define effective Agile teams? (Select all that apply)

feedback.correct: Correct! Effective Agile teams are cross-functional, self-organizing, dedicated, and empowered.
feedback.incorrect: Review the characteristics of high-performing Agile teams: cross-functional, self-organizing, dedicated, and empowered.

questions.explanation: These characteristics enable teams to deliver value efficiently and adapt to change.

questions.question: What are key responsibilities of a Product Owner? (Select all that apply)

feedback.correct: Correct! Product Owners manage the backlog, define acceptance criteria, collaborate with stakeholders, and maximize value.
feedback.incorrect: Review Product Owner responsibilities: backlog management, acceptance criteria, stakeholder collaboration, and value maximization.

questions.explanation: Product Owners bridge business needs with development capabilities.

questions.question: Which are benefits of colocation for Agile teams? (Select all that apply)

feedback.correct: Correct! Colocation enables osmotic communication, easier collaboration, and faster shared understanding.
feedback.incorrect: Review colocation benefits: osmotic communication, easier collaboration, and faster shared understanding.

questions.explanation: Proximity enhances communication effectiveness and team dynamics.

questions.question: What are characteristics of servant leadership? (Select all that apply)

feedback.correct: Correct! Servant leaders remove impediments, coach teams, facilitate growth, and empower others.
feedback.incorrect: Review servant leadership characteristics: removing impediments, coaching, facilitating growth, and empowering others.

questions.explanation: Servant leadership focuses on developing people and removing obstacles to their success.

questions.question: Psychological safety means team members feel safe to take risks and make mistakes without fear of negative consequences.

feedback.correct: Correct! Psychological safety is the belief that one can speak up without risk of punishment or humiliation.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Psychological safety specifically refers to the ability to take risks and make mistakes safely.

questions.explanation: Psychological safety is crucial for innovation, learning, and high team performance.

questions.question: Emotional intelligence is more important than technical skills for Agile team success.

feedback.correct: Correct! Both emotional intelligence and technical skills are important - they complement each other.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. While emotional intelligence is very important, technical skills are also crucial for delivering working software.

questions.explanation: Agile teams need both technical competence and emotional intelligence for optimal performance.

questions.question: Generative culture, according to the Westrum model, is characterized by high cooperation and shared risks.

feedback.correct: Correct! Generative cultures have high cooperation, shared risks, and bridging between teams.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Generative culture in the Westrum model is indeed characterized by high cooperation and shared risks.

questions.explanation: Generative cultures focus on the mission and encourage learning and collaboration.

questions.question: Daily standups should be limited to 15 minutes regardless of team size.

feedback.correct: Correct! While 15 minutes is a guideline for standard team sizes, larger teams may need more time or different approaches.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. The 15-minute guideline works for standard teams, but may need adjustment for different team sizes or contexts.

questions.explanation: Time-boxing should be appropriate for the team size and context, with 15 minutes being a common guideline.

questions.question: Osmotic communication occurs when team members overhear relevant information without actively seeking it.

feedback.correct: Correct! Osmotic communication happens when information flows naturally through proximity and shared workspace.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Osmotic communication specifically refers to overhearing relevant information passively.

questions.explanation: Osmotic communication is a key benefit of colocation and open workspace design.

questions.question: Technical debt should always be eliminated before starting new feature development.

feedback.correct: Correct! Technical debt should be managed strategically, balancing new features with debt reduction based on business value.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Technical debt should be managed strategically, not eliminated entirely before new development.

questions.explanation: Technical debt management requires balancing current business needs with long-term code health.

questions.question: Pair programming always results in 50% productivity loss because two people are working on one task.

feedback.correct: Correct! While pair programming uses two people, it often results in higher quality code, knowledge sharing, and fewer defects.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Pair programming provides quality benefits and knowledge sharing that often compensate for the apparent productivity loss.

questions.explanation: Pair programming's benefits in quality, learning, and defect reduction often outweigh the resource cost.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a Definition of Done?

options.text: Establish shared quality standards and completion criteria

feedback.correct: Correct! Definition of Done ensures everyone understands what 'complete' means for deliverables.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Definition of Done establishes shared understanding of quality and completion standards.

questions.explanation: A clear Definition of Done prevents misunderstandings about work completion and quality expectations.

questions.question: Which leadership style is most effective for Agile environments?

feedback.correct: Correct! Servant leadership aligns with Agile values of empowerment and team autonomy.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Servant leadership is most aligned with Agile principles of empowerment and self-organization.

questions.explanation: Servant leadership supports the Agile values of individuals, interactions, and self-organizing teams.

questions.question: What is the optimal approach for handling conflict in Agile teams?

options.text: Collaborative resolution focusing on interests and solutions

feedback.correct: Correct! Collaborative resolution builds trust and finds solutions that address underlying interests.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Collaborative resolution that focuses on interests and solutions is most effective for Agile teams.

questions.explanation: Collaborative conflict resolution strengthens team relationships and leads to better solutions.

questions.question: What is the most important factor in creating psychological safety?

options.text: Trust and mutual respect among team members

feedback.correct: Correct! Trust and mutual respect form the foundation of psychological safety.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Trust and mutual respect are the most important factors for psychological safety.

questions.explanation: When team members trust and respect each other, they feel safe to take risks and be vulnerable.

questions.question: Which practices help build trust in Agile teams? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Admitting mistakes and learning from them

feedback.correct: Correct! Trust is built through transparency, reliability, vulnerability, and mutual support.
feedback.incorrect: Review trust-building practices: transparent communication, delivering commitments, admitting mistakes, and supporting team members.

questions.explanation: Trust is the foundation of effective Agile teams and must be continuously built and maintained.

questions.question: Which elements are essential for effective distributed Agile teams? (Select all that apply)

feedback.correct: Correct! Distributed teams need good tools, shared practices, overlapping hours, and clear agreements to succeed.
feedback.incorrect: Review distributed team requirements: communication tools, shared practices, overlapping hours, and clear working agreements.

questions.explanation: Distributed teams must work harder to maintain communication and collaboration that collocated teams get naturally.

questions.question: Which are characteristics of high-performing Agile teams? (Select all that apply)

feedback.correct: Correct! High-performing teams combine psychological safety, clear purpose, complementary skills, accountability, and learning.
feedback.incorrect: Review high-performing team characteristics: psychological safety, clear purpose, complementary skills, mutual accountability, and continuous learning.

questions.explanation: High-performing teams excel across multiple dimensions including safety, purpose, skills, accountability, and learning.

questions.question: Psychological safety in Agile teams means team members feel safe to express ideas, ask questions, and admit mistakes without fear of negative consequences.

feedback.correct: Correct! Psychological safety is crucial for innovation, learning, and continuous improvement in Agile teams.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Psychological safety is a fundamental requirement for effective Agile team performance.

questions.explanation: Psychological safety enables open communication, risk-taking, and rapid learning essential for Agile success.

questions.question: Command-and-control leadership styles are most effective for leading Agile teams.

feedback.correct: Correct! Agile teams require servant leadership that empowers and supports rather than commands and controls.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Command-and-control leadership contradicts Agile principles of self-organization and empowerment.

questions.explanation: Agile leadership focuses on enabling team success rather than directing every action.

questions.question: Osmotic communication occurs when team members naturally overhear conversations relevant to their work, improving overall team awareness.

feedback.correct: Correct! Osmotic communication happens in co-located teams where information flows naturally through proximity.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Osmotic communication is a recognized benefit of team co-location.

questions.explanation: Osmotic communication reduces formal communication overhead and increases team awareness.

questions.question: What is the primary role of an Agile coach?

options.text: Make all important decisions for the team
Facilitate team learning and continuous improvement

feedback.correct: Correct! Agile coaches help teams learn, improve, and become more effective in their Agile practices.
feedback.incorrect: Review the role of Agile coaching in facilitating team development and improvement.

questions.explanation: Agile coaches focus on developing team capabilities rather than managing day-to-day operations.

questions.question: Which environmental factor most significantly impacts Agile team performance?

feedback.correct: Correct! Trust and psychological safety are foundational for team collaboration and performance.
feedback.incorrect: Review research on team performance factors and the importance of psychological safety.

questions.explanation: Trust enables open communication, risk-taking, and the collaboration essential for Agile success.

questions.question: Which practices help create psychological safety in Agile teams? (Select all that apply)

feedback.correct: Correct! These practices create an environment where people feel safe to take risks and learn.
feedback.incorrect: Review practices that build psychological safety and encourage learning-oriented behavior.

questions.explanation: Psychological safety requires deliberate practices that normalize learning, questioning, and risk-taking.

questions.question: Which characteristics define servant leadership in Agile contexts? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Serving the team's needs and growth

feedback.correct: Correct! Servant leaders focus on enabling team success rather than directing or controlling.
feedback.incorrect: Review the principles of servant leadership and how they apply in Agile environments.

questions.explanation: Servant leadership inverts traditional hierarchy to focus on team empowerment and development.

questions.question: Information radiators in Agile environments should be updated automatically by tools to ensure accuracy.

feedback.correct: Correct! Manual updates by team members encourage engagement and ownership of the information.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Manual updating of information radiators promotes team engagement and discussion.

questions.explanation: The act of manually updating information radiators creates opportunities for team interaction and reflection.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of an Agile workspace design?

feedback.correct: Correct! Agile workspace design prioritizes team collaboration and communication over individual privacy.
feedback.incorrect: Review the principles behind Agile workspace design and team collaboration needs.

questions.explanation: Physical environment should support the collaborative nature of Agile work.

questions.question: Which factors contribute to successful distributed Agile teams? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Overlapping working hours across time zones
Regular video communication and virtual presence
Shared collaboration tools and virtual workspaces

feedback.correct: Correct! Distributed teams need intentional practices to maintain collaboration and connection.
feedback.incorrect: Review best practices for managing distributed Agile teams effectively.

questions.explanation: Distributed teams must work harder to maintain the collaboration that co-located teams get naturally.

questions.question: Cross-functional team composition means having representatives from every department in the organization.

feedback.correct: Correct! Cross-functional means having all skills needed to deliver the product, not every organizational department.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Cross-functional refers to having necessary skills, not organizational representation.

questions.explanation: Cross-functional teams focus on skills and capabilities needed for product delivery, not organizational structure.

questions.question: What is the most effective team size for Agile development teams?

feedback.correct: Correct! Research shows 5-9 people is optimal for team communication and collaboration effectiveness.
feedback.incorrect: Review research on optimal team sizes for communication and collaboration effectiveness.

questions.explanation: This size allows for diverse skills while maintaining effective communication and coordination.
